page.title: 09ANGLICAN CATHEDRAL
page.content: On{Sunday}most people on Merseyside go to{church.}The two most famous churches in Liverpool are the {Metropolitan (Catholic) Cathedral and {the Anglican Cathedral.}The latter is built of rich red sandstone quarried in Woolton, Liverpool 25 and it rises high over the city on{St. James's {Mount.}The foundation stone was laid on{19th July 1904}by King Edward VII. The architect,{Sir Gilbert Scott}is long since dead and the work was finally completed in 1984. Some stone masons have spent their{entire working {lives}helping to build this cathedral, which is one of the most beautiful churches of modern times. The huge {vaulted roofs}are truly remarkable and the view from the top of the tower is never to be forgotten. In 1985 a {housing development}has been started on derelict land at its very feet.
